entry.def: Detox is treatment given to people who are addicted to drugs or alcohol in order to stop them from being addicted.

example.ex: A patient going through acute detox will have an assigned nurse nearby.
example.tran: 接受急性脱瘾治疗的病人身边会有一名指派的护士看护。

entry.def: A detox is a treatment that is intended to remove poisonous or harmful substances from your body.

example.ex: Overhaul your body with a cleansing detox...
example.tran: 通过清洁排毒法对身体进行“大扫除”。

example.ex: Give yourself a healthy glow on our detox diet.
example.tran: 我们的解毒食谱将会让您容光焕发。

entry.def: If someone who is addicted to drugs or alcohol detoxes, or if another person detoxes them, they undergo treatment which stops them from being addicted.

example.tran: 正努力帮助她们的孩子脱瘾的妈妈们

example.ex: ...drugs binges and failed attempts to detox.
example.tran: 常常肆意吸毒并屡次戒毒失败

entry.def: If you detox, or if something detoxes your body, you do something to remove poisonous or harmful substances from your body.

example.ex: It might be an idea to detox after the indulgences of Christmas...
example.tran: 圣诞节一番放纵之后排排毒或许是个不错的主意。

example.ex: Honey can help to detox the body.

means.word_mean: 1. the hospital ward or clinic in which patients are detoxified

example.en: I jumped in and out of opium habits hut eventually detoxed for good.
example.zh: 我的鸦片烟瘾戒了又犯，犯了又戒，不过后来总算彻底戒掉了。

example.en: We can detox a heroin addict in three weeks.
example.zh: 我们可以在三周之内让一个吸用海洛因的人戒去毒瘾。
